description: Creates up to 100 attendees for an active Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

parameters.name: MeetingId
parameters.description: The Amazon Chime SDK ID of the meeting to which you're adding attendees.

parameters.name: Attendees
parameters.description: The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens. (dict) --- The Amazon Chime SDK attendee fields to create, used with the BatchCreateAttendee action. The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application. Capabilities (dict) --- A list of one or more capabilities. The audio capability assigned to an attendee. The video capability assigned to an attendee. The content capability assigned to an attendee.

nested_params.name: ExternalUserId
nested_params.description: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application. nested_params.name: Capabilities
nested_params.description: A list of one or more capabilities.

nested_items.name: Attendees
nested_items.description: The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens.

nested_items.name: ExternalUserId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

nested_items.name: AttendeeId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Chime SDK attendee ID.

nested_items.name: JoinToken
nested_items.description: The join token used by the Amazon Chime SDK attendee.

nested_items.name: Capabilities
nested_items.description: The capabilities assigned to an attendee: audio, video, or content.

If you specify MeetingFeatures:Video:MaxResolution:None when you create a meeting, all API requests that include SendReceive, Send, or Receive for AttendeeCapabilities:Video will be rejected with ValidationError 400.

If you specify MeetingFeatures:Content:MaxResolution:None when you create a meeting, all API requests that include SendReceive, Send, or Receive for AttendeeCapabilities:Content will be rejected with ValidationError 400.

You can't set content capabilities to SendReceive or Receive unless you also set video capabilities to SendReceive or Receive. If you don't set the video capability to receive, the response will contain an HTTP 400 Bad Request status code. However, you can set your video capability to receive and you set your content capability to not receive.

When you change an audio capability from None or Receive to Send or SendReceive , and if the attendee left their microphone unmuted, audio will flow from the attendee to the other meeting participants.

When you change a video or content capability from None or Receive to Send or SendReceive , and if the attendee turned on their video or content streams, remote attendees can receive those streams, but only after media renegotiation between the client and the Amazon Chime back-end server.

nested_items.name: Errors
nested_items.description: If the action fails for one or more of the attendees in the request, a list of the attendees is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

nested_items.name: ExternalUserId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.
